flawed_nl_solution:
After 20 new students joined the class at the start of the school year, the number of students increased to 160+20 = <<160+20=200>>200
However, at the end of the year, 1/3*200 = <<1/3*200=200/3>>200/3 students had transferred from the school.
The total number of students remaining in the school at the end of the year is 200-200/3 = <<200-200/3=400/3>>400/3
#### 400/3

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 180, not 200. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
